intro: Dendroviguiera guerrerana, commonly known as the Guerrero tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and ample sunlight. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Dendroviguiera guerrerana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
